description.narrative: Mercy Corps believes that if youth learn relevant knowledge skills, and engage socially, peacefully and economically, then they will be able to lead secure and peaceful lives. The No Lost Generation program in Erbil, Kurdish Region? Iraq will work with refugees, IDPs and host community adolescents ages 13?17 and supportive role model youth ages 17?25 to strengthen social capital and develop their knowledge, skills and ability to collaboratively pursue personal and community development goals. Through participation in psychosocial, life skills, short?term goal setting and recreational activities, as well as community projects to build social cohesion implemented jointly by refugee, IDP and host community youth, adolescent girls and boys will develop leadership and decision?making skills while gaining greater confidence, self?esteem, self-efficacy and trust in those around them. Mercy Corps is particularly sensitive to the markedly different challenges and opportunities faced by boys and girls and the organization provides age and sex divided spaces, learning materials, and experiences, to allow each young person to develop to their fullest potential.

The program will train an estimated 2,500 adolescents in Erbil, KR, Iraq through life skills and resilience courses and reach 8,000 in recreational activities and community events and 16,000 community members through awareness campaigns and community impact projects. In addition the program will train 100 coaches and 100 youth leaders to serve as mentors and instructors for safe space programming including life skills courses, recreational activities and community event support.
